definition: to overstep the norm/to go out of bounds

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to confine/to lock up/to pen in
pen (pig)/a fold
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
everything in disorder (idiom)/in a hideous mess/obscene/dirty/filthy
to muck out/to clean muck from a cowshed, pigsty etc
one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
to work half-heartedly/to get by in a job with the minimum effort
to talk provokingly or nonsensically
variant of 烏七八糟|乌七八糟[wu1 qi1 ba1 zao1]
unpleasant/disagreeable
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
(dialect) silly
bluster/ruckus/to boast loudly
scatter-brained/thoughtless
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
to give a backward kick (e.g. of a horse)

bad kind/scoundrel
